title: Can you ban emote mastery spammers?
body: I literally see this shit every game, every champ, every 2 seconds. Can you ban these people or can we mute/hide it?, Its annoying and retarded  and done by kids with tiny small d1cks.

replies.body: It's done to tilt, and it's clearly working.

Its pointless, distracting and needs to go. If not,** why not add a key that makes your character flash psychedelic colors at lightning speed**, WHY NOT?, Just another pointless distraction to annoy from actual freaking Gameplay.

Spamming is actually reportable, though it ranks rather low in the graveness scale. That said you can use "/ignore @champion" or just "/ignore enemy" to block emotes as well as taunts and jokes.
If you mute the player it mutes the mastery emote- at least it does for me.
I usually drop my mastery when I do something stupid, lol

Mute Emotes is a thing. Click the little smiling face icon where all the other mute buttons are. Problem solved.

But I do want to make it a point that what they want to do to you guys complaining about it is hella working. It tilts me when it's done to me, and I know it tilts others when I flash the level 7 Soraka, Nami, or Janna mastery.

I don't think literally means quite what you think it means.

lit·er·al·ly
ˈlidərəlē,ˈlitrəlē/
adverb
in a literal manner or sense; exactly.
"the driver took it literally when asked to go straight across the traffic circle"
synonyms:	exactly, precisely, actually, really, truly; More
**informal** <--------------------
used for emphasis or to express strong feeling while not being literally true.
"I have received literally thousands of letters"
As the first commenter said, mastery spam is used to tilt. It's a good strategy for making your opponents play worse. I do it sometimes, though not very often.
